answers.answer: Dont freak out. I am on my second pregnancy and have GD this time. You will have to test your blood sugar and watch what you eat. Its not bad. Dont freak out. Portion control is the main thing. Its not horrible. I was very upset when I found out. I am almost 34 weeks and found out at 27. I have a healthy baby girl in there that they do moniter closer for her weight but dont stress about it. Stress will make your sugar higher. Just listen to your specialist and remember it is all worth it in the end. You can do this. Dont let it scare and stress you.

Don't freak out sweetie. I have gd as well.  I was diagnosed with it at 29 weeks and then the clinic didn't get me the referral to the specialist till I was about 33 weeks. My Dr then freaked me out saying I could have a still born or a huge baby and such but so far my baby is very healthy and the only thing I have is lots of fluid bc of the gd. Just like badyas said you'll have to monitor and portion control your food and what you eat , that's all.

My mom didn't know she has gestational diabetes, until after I was born, and everything turned out okay. Sure I was huge, but the doctors at the hospital kept my mom from hemorrhaging after the shock of pushing out such a big baby.  You and baby are in good hands, as your doctors are already on top of it.
Wow that's crazy but that's a blessing for you and your mom that you guys came out fine. I'm praying about it and trying to stay positive but I guess it's all new to me and a shocking

I just found out this week I have gd as well.  My Dr said not to freak out or go home n Google it because I will scare my self n it will do way more harm than good. She said if you have to have something happen during pregnancy gd is definitely the thing you want. It's easily managed n a big baby is much better than a small one. It ***** but don't freak. Everything will be fine!
Thanks Mommie I need the uplifting ! I just have to watch what I eat now that's all.

question: I just found out I have diabetes and I can't stop crying I don't know what to do or nothing I'm 32 wks and a ftm. I didn't have it before my pregnancy and my baby is healthy so from what I know and her weight is great but I have to see a specialist on Monday so they can talk to me more about it and teach me how to control it but I just heard all the bad things that can happen if it's not control right. And that scares me ! My boyfriend is alway right now on football so I have no one to talk to right now.
